hero.question: Will the DHS shutdown end after March 31, 2026?
hero.prob_take: The 10-point spike signals fresh confidence that Congress will actually fund the DHS before the deadline, likely driven by recent backroom deal signals or a shift in political calculus away from brinkmanship. At 57.4%, the market is pricing in roughly even odds, but history says shutdown theater almost always resolves by the deadline, meaning smart money should be hunting for YES to trade higher as we approach late March.

daily_take.headline: DHS Shutdown Endgame Priced In, But March Deadline Just Got Real
daily_take.deck: The market jumped 10 points in 24 hours on fresh shutdown noise, pushing odds to 57.4% that this thing wraps by March 31. Here's the thing: Congress always caves before the clock hits zero, but this deadline is tighter than last time. The sharp money isn't betting on a deal, it's betting on the speed of the cave. Current price assumes medium difficulty. If negotiations stall past mid-March, these odds don't hold.

sidebar.headline: German Greens just spiked 26 points in one day. Watch for polling data within 48 hours, this move smells like leaked internal numbers from one of the major parties.
sidebar.label: Baden-Württemberg Greens: 33.8%

sidebar.headline: Virginia-Duke line compression from a 30 point swing signals sharp action on both sides. Current 16.5% for Duke is trap odds if Cavaliers are favored by the books.
sidebar.label: Duke Moneyline: 16.5%

sidebar.headline: Anduril IPO odds tanked 22 points while the defense tech space heats up. Market's pricing in a 2027 delay, but if defense spending bills pass Congress this spring, re-rate higher.
sidebar.label: Anduril IPO Before 2027: 25.0%
